title: Bug 18028 - 'Rename Package' Fails with Unexpected Exception
description: The 'Rename Package' functionality doesn't verify if all resources are writable, causing unexpected exceptions during the renaming process.
OB: When creating a package containing a Compilation Unit (CU) and making the CU readonly, an attempt to rename the package results in an unexpected exception dialog after the renaming process.
EB: The expected behavior is that the 'Rename Package' action should include a precondition check for read-only files within packages to prevent unexpected exceptions.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a package with a Compilation Unit (CU) in it.
2. Make the CU readonly.
3. Attempt to rename the package.
Observation: After the renaming process is complete, an unexpected exception dialog will appear.
